result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Zollicoffer, Tommy Deville

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:17 AM Defendant Tommy Deville Zollicoffer in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Tommy Deville Zollicoffer.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Defendant Tommy Deville Zollicoffer in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Tommy Deville Zollicoffer.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Tommy Deville Zollicoffer in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:11 AM Defendant Tommy Deville Zollicoffer in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant states his is currently getting assistance with funds to retain counsel.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant in regards to applying at the Public Defenders Office.  The defendant states he wishes to retain private counsel.  The Court will grant one final adjournment for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court informs the defendant there must be counsel by the next date and this court would allow his counsel to appear via zoom if needed.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:18 AM Defendant Tommy Deville Zollicoffer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informs the Court Attorney Michael Chernin represents him.  The Court contacts Attorney Michael Chernin by telephone who indicates he has not been retained in this matter and only represents the defendant in his Milwaukee Count case.  The defendant states he intends to retain other counsel for this case.  The Court will adjourn for status of counsel for three weeks to give the defendant the opportunity to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Apply cash bail previously posted.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS within one business day.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:46 PM Defendant Tommy Deville Zollicoffer in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Griffis appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court notes the defendant has a plea/sentencing date in Milwaukee County on 7/22/22.  Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Tommy Deville Zollicoffer issued on 07-01-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.
